comment:
Dr. Hall is very nice and clearly cares about what our class is about! However, I did not like this class because the textbook is HORRIBLE. Was it even edited? Who wrote it?
1. Convoluted phrasings that are hard to understand
2. Random unimportant things are highlighted
3. So many graphs 
4. Too many paragraphs, not enough bullet points
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: she has a lot of busy work, if you miss an assignment you cant make it up, takes forever to respond. no exams but quizzes, discussion posts min of 150 words and respond to 2 people 50 words min.

Dr. Hall wasn't the worst professor I've had but is far from the best. Gives so much busy work, which I am assuming is to "make up" for class time since it was an online course. Still, I typically devoted an entire day to complete all or most of the work (around 10 hours total). Way too much for a core class that doesn't matter in the long run.

two-week module schedule, one for reading the chapter and taking an assignment and then assessment, then the 2nd week for the lab and discussion. the chapters are long, devote like 3-7 hours a week to read, it's necessary to get good grades. went through an entire notebook of notes lol. enjoyed the content much more than I thought I would tho.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Definitely take a course with Dr. Hall, she made the class very clear and the workload was very manageable. Attendance is based on in-class activities if you take the hybrid courses. Would be in courses with the professor again for sure!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: One discussion post or paper every week, I found them to be pretty easy. Quizzes are open note and the answers come from the storymaps and you get two tries on each one. The midterm and final are papers where you summarize each module.

She a very nice person that she want her students to succeed. Yes, her tests are open notes and no lockdown. But, her tests are coming from her Story Maps. So you won't be able to look up at the internet. Also, she is a very strict grader, and get ready to write a lot because this class is mostly about writing around 250 words.

I loved the style this professor had this class set up. She was very organized and cared about her student's grades. She did one quiz and one assignment a week. I would find it hard to fail this class considering all the extra credit she does at the end of the semester. 100% would recommend.

Automates as much as she possibly can about the course. Discussion posts have a really high minimum word count and give you nothing to go off of. I can understand wanting to provide flexibility but this is just a lack of effort, plain and simple. Makes me hate the subject, even though I'm autistic and its one of my special interests...

Amazing professor. She doesn't reopen assignments past deadlines but as long as you manage your time well you're going to be fine. Super kind, super caring, and there's lots of extra credit opportunities (literally just show up to class and you get extra credit). Lots of assignments, but again, just budget your time and you'll be fine. TAKE HER!

A really great professor in GEOG1125 (they don't give a choice for 1125 on this website)! She answers emails very quick, her assignments were really simple and easy if you read her storymaps, but you could tell she really cares about what she teaches. She gives two chances on her quizzes and no exams except a paper over the course at the end.

Overall, not a bad professor. Some grading criteria was not clear and due dates were very specific for discussion posts (you couldn't post all parts of your discussions on the same day). Grading was a little behind but grading criteria is not difficult. Dr. Hall is a decent professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Overall terrible. Not only is the course itself kinda tough, she makes it even harder by adding unnecessary discussion posts that have unclear due dates. Not to mention that she constantly puts wrong answers in for labs and has to give us the right answers so we can complete them. In conclusion, she is a terrible professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework
